class unlock, weapon stats and class description
revision.text:
{{Spoiler}} [[File:XC3 Soulhacker Weapon Icon.png|thumb|The Soulhacker class icon]] {{quote|A special class, enabling a variety of fighting styles using skills and Arts stolen from enemies.|Class menu description}} '''Soulhacker''' is a special [[class (XC3)|class]] in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Soulhacker is the class of [[Triton]]. It cannot equip any Master Arts and Skills from other classes, with the specific exception of Noah and Mio's unique Talent Arts. Instead, it acquires a wide variety of Arts and Skills from enemies. Its Talent Art, [[Final Countdown]], becomes more powerful with each Art or Skill learned by the class. A Soulhacker can equip three each of [[Keves]]i Enemy Arts, [[Agnus|Agnian]] Enemy Arts, and Enemy Skills at a time. As a Kevesi class, the Kevesi Arts are considered Class Arts and the Agnian Arts are considered Master Arts for most purposes. For example, Agnian Arts are uncharged at the start of battle, unless the wearer equips an Accessory that charges Master Arts. The Arts and Skills thus acquired can be further upgraded by meeting criteria specific to each individual Art or Skill; these requirements can be seen from the Soul Hack submenu, which is accessible by pressing Y from the Heroes menu. It is unlocked by completing the [[Hero Quest]] ''[[Doing It My Way]]''. The [[Class Rank (XC3)|Class Rank]] maximum is increased to 20 by completing the Ascension Quest ''[[My Memories]]''. {{clr}} ==Class Aptitude and Unlock Requirements== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%; valign:center;" !Party Member |[[File:Icon chara battle n0ah.png|60px]]
'''[[Noah]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 1.png|60px]]
'''[[Mio]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 2.png|60px]]
'''[[Eunie]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 3.png|60px]]
'''[[Taion]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 4.png|60px]]
'''[[Lanz]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 5.png|60px]]
'''[[Sena]]''' |- !Aptitude |[[File:XC3 Aptitude C Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude A Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude D Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude S Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]] |- !Class Unlock Points Required |5,625 |2,815 |4,690 |6,565 |''Class Inheritor'' |3,750 |} == Class Rank Requirements == {| class="xc1 centered" width="45%" ! Rank ! CP needed ! Nopon Coin Cost |- | 1 | colspan="2" | None |- | 2 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 3 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 4 | 285 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 5 | 285 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 6 | 345 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 7 | 345 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 8 | 375 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 9 | 375 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 10 | 400 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | colspan="3" class="event" | Complete ''[[My Memories]]'' |- | 11 | 335 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 12 | 335 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 13 | 450 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 14 | 450 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 15 | 560 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 16 | 560 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 17 | 670 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 18 | 670 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 19 | 725 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 20 | 840 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |} {{clr}} == Role Skills == Although it appears as an Attacker on the class menu, the Soulhacker can be any role. It has a special Role Skill slot that determines its stat spread and role, including [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Ability]], and ability to revive allies if a Healer. * Power Soul: Attacker with high attack but low accuracy. * Strike Soul: Attacker with good accuracy and evasion. * Tough Soul: Defender with high HP. * Dodge Soul: Defender specialized in evasion. * Heal Soul: Healer with high Healing Power. * Balanced Soul: Healer with balanced stats. === Class Stats === The Role Skill set on a character determines the multipliers that are applied to a character's base stats (see their individual pages for their base stats), as well as their Physical and Ether Defense. Unlike all other classes, Soulhacker class stats for player-controlled Soulhackers only increase once at a certain Rank, as opposed to gaining stat increases at every Rank. Internally, only two sets of multipliers are programmed for each role skill, as oppposed to one set of multipliers for each Rank of a class. The lowest Rank at which the second set of multipliers is used is listed in each table; at Ranks lower than this, the first set is used. Power Soul=

Power Soul

{| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 70% || 120% || 10% || 95% || 70% || 15% || 5% |- | 15 || 75% || 130% || 15% || 105% || 75% || 20% || 10% |} |-| Strike Soul=

Strike Soul

{| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 70% || 105% || 25% || 110% || 90% || 10% || 10% |- | 15 || 75% || 115% || 30% || 120% || 95% || 15% || 15% |} |-| Tough Soul=

Tough Soul

{| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 115% || 90% || 10% || 90% || 60% || 35% || 30% |- | 20 || 125% || 95% || 15% || 95% || 65% || 45% || 35% |} |-| Dodge Soul=

Dodge Soul

{| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 100% || 90% || 10% || 100% || 115% || 30% || 35% |- | 20 || 110% || 95% || 15% || 105% || 120% || 35% || 45% |} |-| Heal Soul=

Heal Soul

{| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 65% || 70% || 95% || 105% || 85% || 5% || 20% |- | 20 || 70% || 75% || 100% || 110% || 90% || 10% || 30% |} |-| Balanced Soul=

Balanced Soul

{| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 60% || 80% || 65% || 100% || 85% || 5% || 25% |- | 20 || 65% || 90% || 75% || 105% || 90% || 10% || 30% |} == Weapon Stats == The character's Attack stat after being modified by the class stats as determined by Role Skill is further modified by adding the class's weapon stat, which depends on the character's [[Level (XC3)|Level]], to obtain the final base Attack stat. These weapon stats also determine the character's Critical Rate and Block Rate, and are independent of the character's currently set Role Skill (the same weapon stats also apply to Triton). Characters temporarily assume these weapon stats to calculate relevant statistics when using a Master Art from this Class without it being part of a Fusion Art, although in practice this can only be applied to [[Final Countdown]], the class's only Master Art. {| class="xc1 centered" width="60%" ! Level !! Attack !! Critical Rate !! Block Rate |- | 1 || 19 || 15% || 25% |- | 10 || 41 || 15% || 25% |- | 20 || 74 || 15% || 25% |- | 30 || 115 || 15% || 25% |- | 40 || 160 || 15% || 25% |- | 50 || 214 || 15% || 25% |- | 60 || 273 || 15% || 25% |- | 70 || 338 || 15% || 25% |- | 80 || 412 || 15% || 25% |- | 90 || 495 || 15% || 25% |- | 99 || 580 || 15% || 25% |} == Soul Hack == [[File:XC3 Tutorial Soul Hacked.jpg|thumb|Splash screen upon a successful Soul Hack]] To Soul Hack a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]], it must be defeated while any member of the party possesses the Soul Hack Skill. This means that someone must either be in the Soulhacker class, or equip Soul Hack as a Master Skill. Triton himself does not possess the Soul Hack skill and thus cannot hack monsters himself. If [[Noah]] is equipped with the Soul Hack skill and uses [[Unlimited Sword]], the skill (alongside any other skills he has equipped) will be replaced with the special skill set brought about by Unlimited Sword. Thus, defeating a Unique Monster while he is using [[Lucky Seven]] with no other party members having Soul Hack will not result in a Soul Hack.https://youtu.be/mQX6cDStiN8 Video showcasing the interaction between Unlimited Sword and Soul Hack [[File:Soulhack Target.png|thumb|100px|Soul Hack crosshair]] When a Unique Monster is targeted while a member has Soul Hack and its Art/Skill has not yet been learned, a purple-pink Soul Hack crosshair will appear over it to indicate it can be hacked. Once hacked, an Art/Skill may be equipped by any Soulhacker, regardless of who hacked it. === List of Arts and Skills to hack === {{main|Unique Monster (XC3)}} The list of Unique Monsters includes their granted Art/Skill. == Default Arts == The Soulhacker class starts with the following Arts unlocked. The non-Talent Arts are considered Kevesi Arts for purposes of determining cooldowns as well as for determining Arts allocation in a character's Arts Palette. * '''[[Final Countdown]]''' (Talent Art), Dmg+ per Soul Hack * '''[[Draining Vacuum]]''', Area heal on hit * '''[[Dig]]''', AOE / Side attack↑ * '''[[Double Bite]]''', Cancel attack↑ == Enemy Arts == The Soulhacker class cannot equip Arts from other Agnian classes in the game for its Master Arts; instead all of its remaining Arts are unlocked through Soul Hacking. This includes both Agnian Arts which behave in the role of Master Arts, as well as Kevesi Arts that can be used in place of the default Arts. {| class="xc1 sortable" width=100% ! Art ! Recharge Type ! Effect ! Unique Monster ! Upgrade Condition |- | [[Aquaball]] | Keves | AOE/Land↑/[[Attack Down|Atk down]] | [[Covetous Gerondon]] | Deal 300,000 damage with this Art |- | [[Aquatic Missile]] | Agnus | [[Topple (XC3)|Topple]] | [[Frolicking Parker]] | Use the Art 100 times |- | [[Battle Pheromone]] | Agnus | AOE/[[Attack Up|Atk+]]/[[Critical Rate Up (XC3)|Crit. rate+]] | [[Gracious Titania]] | Obtain 130,000 [[Gold|G]] (only counts some ways, e.g. auto selling) |- | [[Beast Howl]] | Keves | AOE / High aggro | [[Lapdog Veece]] | Defeat Lapdog Veece 15 times |- | [[Bomberhead]] | Agnus | [[Launch (XC3)|Launch]] | [[Oceanic Lucera]] | Use the Art 100 times |- | [[Bubble Cloud]] | Agnus | AOE / Machines↑ | [[Househunter Carly]] | Deal 300,000 damage with this Art |- | [[Burrowing Rocket]] | Agnus | Evade / Flying↑ | [[Keen Chicky-Chicky]] | Deal 300,000 damage with this Art |- | [[Butterfly Dust]] | Agnus | AOE / [[Defense Up|Def. up]] | [[Perturbed Bilkin]] | Obtain 100,000 [[Gold|G]] (only counts some ways, e.g. auto selling) |- | [[Cavalry]] | Keves | [[Shackle Blocking|Shackle blocking]] | [[Littlefort Morley]] | Defeat Littlefort Morley 10 times |- | [[Cursed Cuisine]] | Agnus | [[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] | [[Crystalline DuGarre]] | Use the Art 100 times |- | [[Desperate Charge]] | Keves | AOE/[[Fast Recharge|Fast charge]]/[[Critical Hit Plus|Crit.+]] | [[King Krawkin]] | Defeat King Instead, it can equip 3 enemy skills acquired from defeating unique monsters. These skills are upgraded when a specific condition is met, and their stats increase. {| class="xc1 sortable" width=100% ! Skill ! Effect ! Unique Monster ! |- | Wild Tendencies | Grants 30/50% resistance to all debuffs | [[Desired Oruria]] | Block 100 attacks with this skill set (not Interlinked) |- | Wolf Spirit | Own auto-attack rate increases for each ally with the same role as self | [[Thaumawolf Bajeek]] | Defeat 150 monsters with this skill set |} == Triton == Triton himself functions differently from the player's version of the class. Like most Heroes, he has only five Arts (of which he can equip three) and a pre-set list of Skills. He is an Attacker, focusing on buffing his attack power before dealing high burst damage. According to him, over the years he's forgotten most of the abilities he's learned except for the ones he used most often. === Class Multipliers === Unlike player-controlled Soulhackers, class multipliers apply normally to Triton, where he gains stat increases by Rank; however, only Rank 10 and 20 values are used. In practice, these values are always indirectly modifying or setting his own base stats, since Triton cannot change classes. {| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 80% || 120% || 25% || 110% || 100% || 15% || 5% |- | 10 || 80% || 125% || 30% || 115% || 105% || 17% || 7% |- | 20 || 80% || 130% || 35% || 120% || 110% || 20% || 10% |} === Arts === * '''[[Captain Strike]]''', Pierce (%)/[[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] * '''[[Magnificent Fist]]''', Gain charge on hit * '''[[Peril Punch]]''', AOE / Side Attack Up ↑ * '''[[Pirate Lariat]]''', [[Topple (XC3)|Topple]] * '''[[Ultra Boost]]''', Atk up / Def. down === Skills === * '''Underworld Rage''': Boosts damage dealt by 60-100% each time an ally is incapacitated (to a maximum of 200%). * '''Amazing Growth''': Boosts damage dealt based on the amount of battle time elapsed. * '''Recharge Cheer''': 10-12% chance to keep recharge when using Art. * '''Magic Transmutation''': Boosts damage dealt by 60-100% when afflicted by a debuff. === Stat Increases === Only the values for Ranks 10 and 20 are used. Internally, these skills are considered distinct from the equippable skills used by Ouroboros Soulhackers. {| class="xc1 centered" style="width:80%;" !Class Rank !Underworld Rage !Amazing Growth !Recharge Cheer !Magic Transmutation |- | 1 | 60% | 0.25% | 10% | 60% |- | 5 | 70% | 0.3% | 10.5% | 70% |- | 10 | 80% | 0.35% | 11% | 80% |- | 15 | 90% | 0.4% | 11.5% | 90% |- | 20 | 100% | 0.5% | 12% | 100% |} {{clr}} == Gallery == === Artwork === XC3 Triton Artwork.png|Triton, a Soulhacker === In-Game Renders === Icon soulhack.png|Enemy Soulhack Icons Soulhack Locked.png|Locked icon Soulhack Acquired.png|Acquired icon Soulhack Upgraded.png|Upgraded icon === Screenshots === Soulhacker Noah.png|Noah as a Soulhacker Soulhacker Mio.png|Mio as a Soulhacker Soulhacker Eunie.png|Eunie as a Soulhacker Soulhacker Taion.png|Taion as a Soulhacker Soulhacker Lanz.png|Lanz as a Soulhacker Soulhacker Sena.png|Sena as a Soulhacker [[Category:XC3 Classes]]
